result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy M Weisner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: BAIL APPLIED. COSTS AND DNA PAID IN FULL.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with Tina M.
Provide DNA Sample if not previously done.
Attend Domestic Violence Counseling.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - nonworking hours. Standard release. Credit for 16 days.
COMMENCE BY 5/30/16 by 5pm.
Consecutive to: other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Timothy M Weisner in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in. Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Attorney Cotton has received discovery and an offer and requests the matter be set for trial and the other two cases to tag along.  Any motions to be filed by February 29, 2016.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Cotton moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause.  Defendant is bound over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
